thread.title: Gallery: Can you believe these 12 films didn't win an Oscar?
thread.title_full: Gallery: Can you believe these 12 films didn't win an Oscar?

title: Gallery: Can you believe these 12 films didn't win an Oscar?
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Gallery: Can you believe these 12 films didn't win an Oscar? You might be surprised at what movies ended up with nothing at the end of the Oscars ceremony. USA TODAY tracks down films you thought would have won an Academy Award. First up: 'It's a Wonderful Life' (1946) | The staple of holiday season television was nominated in five categories: actor for James Stewart; directing for Frank Capra; best picture, film editing and sound recording. USA TODAY tracks down films you thought would have won an Academy Award. First up: 'It's a Wonderful Life' (1946) | The staple of holiday season television was nominated in five categories: actor for James Stewart; directing for Frank Capra; best picture, film editing and sound recording. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Gallery: Can you believe these 12 films didn't win an Oscar? None You might be surprised at what movies ended up with nothing at the end of the Oscars ceremony. USA TODAY tracks down films you thought would have won an Academy Award. First up: 'It's a Wonderful Life' (1946) | The staple of holiday season television was nominated in five categories: actor for James Stewart; directing for Frank Capra; best picture, film editing and sound recording. NBC Universal None 'Rebel Without a Cause' (1955) | The drama famous for starring James Dean was nominated for three Academy Awards: supporting actor for Sal Mineo; supporting actress for Natalie Wood and writing. NONE, XXX WARNER BROS. None 'Psycho' (1960) | The classic thriller earned four Oscar nominations: supporting actress for Janet Leigh; directing for Alfred Hitchcock; art direction and cinematography. UNIVERSAL None 'A Clockwork Orange'| (1971) The dystopian crime thriller directed by Stanley Kubrick earned nominations for best picture, director, writing and film editing. Associated Press None 'Broadcast News' (1982) | The television news drama earned seven nominations: actor for William Hurt; actress for Holly Hunter; supporting actor for Albert Brooks; best picture, cinematography, film editing and writing. Kerry Hayes, 20th Century Fox None 'The Color Purple'| (1985) The Steven Spielberg- directed film based on the Alice Walker novel got a whopping 11 Oscar nominations: picture, actress, supporting actress (2), writing, cinematography, art direction, costume designer, original song, original score and make-up. WARNER BROS. None 'Awakenings' (1990) | Robin Williams starred in this medical drama based on the work of Dr. Oliver Sacks. It earned three nominations: actor for Robert De Niro; best picture and writing. Louis Goldman, Columbia Pictures None 'The Shawshank Redemption' (1994) | The drama about a deep friendship that develops between two inmates was nominated in seven categories: actor for Morgan Freeman; best picture, cinematography, film editing, music, sound and writing. Michael Weinstein, Castle Rock Entertainment None 'Quiz Show' (1994) | Robert Redford earned a nomination for directing this historical drama starring Ralph Fiennes, about a rigged game show. Other categories it was nominated in: supporting actor for Paul Scofield; best picture and writing. BARRY WETCHER, HOLLYWOOD PICTURES None Gangs of New York (2002) | Martin Scorsese earned a nomination (1 of 10 for the movie) for directing this crime drama set in violent 1860s New York City. Others: actor for Daniel Day-Lewis; best picture, cinematography, art direction, costume design, film editing, music, sound and writing. Mario TursiI, Miramax Films None 'Moneyball' (2011) | This baseball drama based on the Michael Lewis book didn't score a single Oscar after getting nominated in six categories: actor for Brad Pitt; supporting actor for Jonah Hill; best picture, film editing, sound mixing and writing. Melinda Sue Gordon, Columbia Pictures None 'Captain Phillips' (2013) | The biographical thriller about the hijacking of a ship by Somali pirates earned six nominations: supporting actor for Barkhad Abdi; best picture; film editing, sound editing, sound mixing and writing. Jasin Boland, Columbia Pictures Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
